overview_of_class: This seminar discusses archaeological field research designed to answer important anthropological questions. It is intended for advanced undergraduates and first-year graduate students to enable them to design independent research embedded within multistage regional projects. Major topics include regional surveys and regional analysis, site plans and site sampling, archaeological stratigraphy and horizontal exposure. How can archaeological data be used to test ideas in social theory?
name: Introduction to Archaeology Research Design & Methods
title: WCAS ANTHRO 322-0-1 Introduction to Archaeology Research Design & Methods

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: 1) weekly "engagement essays," no more than 2 pages, single spaced, summaries of the main issues raised by the readings, what you feel about their importance, and how the readings will help you position your research (honors thesis or 1st year paper) (due on Wednesdays) 2) research proposal identifying appropriate questions for investigation, data requirements to answer these questions, and an adequate research design.
